messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Goat cheese and other fabulous stuff
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/23/02 10:52:53 AM, jnjstau@gvtc.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/23/02 10:52:53 AM, jnjstau@... writes:

<< I would live way out in West Texas where you can't even pick up
a radio station. >>

IS there such a place? I think you can always get a gospel station. <g>

messages.subject: Goat cheese and other fabulous stuff
messages.msgSnippet: I have a recipe for ricotta that I just love.  Takes about 15 minutes to make and good enough to eat with a spoon.  We also make
messages.messageBody:
<<Do you make goat cheese?>>

I have a recipe for ricotta that I just love. Takes about 15 minutes to
make and good enough to eat with a spoon. We also make goat yogurt (which
makes a fantastic strawberry smoothie) and we like the milk just raw and
plain as well.

We also raise rabbits and use the meat. Tastes like the sweetest chicken
you ever had. I tried to tan the hides this time but I didn't get the salt
on thick enough to ward off the flies. Live and learn. We just got our
baby chicks so we are trying those for the first time this year.

<<You are living my dream>>

This is actually a compromise between dh and myself. He would live in
Manhattan. I would live way out in West Texas where you can't even pick up
a radio station. Not surprisingly, we think of "The Theme from Green
Acres" as "our song" and dh refers to our home as "the Haney place." We
just have a couple of acres but it is plenty of room for what we are doing.

Julie
